Title: Title and extent of operation of the Code
Description: Defines the title of the code as 'The Indian Penal Code' and states that it extends to whole of India except Jammu and Kashmir

Title: Punishment of offences committed within India
Description: States that every person shall be liable for punishment for every act or omission contrary to the code provisions, committed within India

Title: Punishment of offences committed beyond, but which by law may be tried within, India
Description: Specifies that any person liable to be tried for an offence committed beyond India shall be dealt with according to the Code provisions

Title: Amount of fine
Description: If no sum is expressed to which a fine may extend, the amount is unlimited but not excessive.

Title: Limit to imprisonment for non-payment of fine

Description: Specifies the description of imprisonment for non-payment of a fine.

Title: Imprisonment for non-payment of fine when offence punishable with fine only
Description: Specifies terms for imprisonment in default of payment of fine for offences punishable with fine only.

Title: Imprisonment to terminate on payment of fine
Description: Specifies that imprisonment for non-payment of fine terminates upon payment of the fine.

Title: Termination of imprisonment on payment of proportional part of fine
Description: Specifies conditions under which imprisonment for non-payment of fine can be terminated.

Title: Fine leviable within six years or during imprisonment
Description: Specifies the period within which a fine can be levied.

Title: Limit of punishment of offence made up of several offences
Description: Limits punishment in cases where an act is made up of parts, each of which is an offence.

Title: Punishment of person guilty of one of several offences, the judgment stating that it is doubtful of which
Description: Specifies punishment in cases where it is doubtful of which of several offences the person is guilty.

Title: Solitary confinement
Description: Specifies the conditions under which solitary confinement can be ordered.

Title: Limit of solitary confinement
Description: Limits the duration of solitary confinement.

Title: Enhanced punishment for certain offences after previous conviction
Description: Specifies enhanced punishment for repeated offences under certain chapters.

Title: Act done by a person bound, or by mistake of fact believing himself bound, by law
Description: No offence is committed if an act is done by someone who believes in good faith that they are legally bound to do it.

Title: Act of Judge when acting judicially
Description: No offence is committed by a Judge when acting judicially in the exercise of any power given by law.

Title: Act done pursuant to the judgment or order of Court
Description: No offence is committed if an act is done following a judgment or order of a Court.

Title: Act done by a person justified, or by mistake of fact believing himself justified, by law
Description: No offence is committed by a person who does an act in good faith, believing themselves legally justified.

Title: Accident in doing a lawful act
Description: No offence is committed if an act is done by accident or misfortune without any criminal intention or knowledge.

Title: Act likely to cause harm, but done without criminal intent, and to prevent other harm
Description: No offence is committed if an act is done without criminal intent to prevent or avoid other harm.

Title: Act of a child under seven years of age
Description: An act done by a child under seven years of age is not an offence.

Title: Act of a child above seven and under twelve of immature understanding
Description: An act done by a child above seven but under twelve, who has not attained sufficient maturity of understanding, is not considered an offence.

Title: Act of a person of unsound mind
Description: No offence is committed by a person who, at the time of doing it, is incapable of knowing the nature of the act due to unsoundness of mind.

Title: Act of a person incapable of judgment by reason of intoxication caused against his will
Description: An act done by a person who, at the time of doing it, is incapable of knowing the nature of the act due to involuntary intoxication, is not an offence.

Title: Offence requiring a particular intent or knowledge committed by one who is intoxicated
Description: In cases where an act requires a specific intent or knowledge, the fact that the person doing the act was intoxicated is irrelevant.

Title: Act not intended and not known to be likely to cause death or grievous hurt, done by consent
Description: No offence is committed if an act not intended to cause death or grievous hurt, and not known to be likely to cause death or grievous hurt, is done by consent.

Title: Act not intended to cause death done by consent in good faith for person's benefit
Description: Any act not intended to cause death is not an offence if it is done in good faith for someone's benefit with their consent.

Title: Act done in good faith for benefit of child or insane person by or by consent of guardian
Description: Acts done in good faith for the benefit of a child under twelve or an insane person are not offences if done with the guardian's consent.

Title: Consent known to be given under fear or misconception
Description: A consent given under fear or misconception is not considered valid in the eyes of the law.

Title: Exclusion of acts which are offences independently of harm caused
Description: Exceptions in sections 87, 88, and 89 do not extend to acts that are offences independently of any harm caused.

Title: Act done in good faith for benefit of a person without consent
Description: An act done in good faith for someone's benefit without their consent is not an offence if it is impossible to obtain consent in time to be beneficial.

Title: Communication made in good faith
Description: No communication made in good faith is an offence by reason of any harm to the person to whom it is made if it is made for their benefit.

Title: Act to which a person is compelled by threats
Description: Except for murder and certain offences against the state punishable with death, nothing is an offence if done by a person compelled by threats of instant death.

Title: Act causing slight harm
Description: Nothing is an offence by reason that it causes, or is intended to cause, harm if that harm is so slight that no person of ordinary sense and temper would complain of such harm.

Title: Things done in private defence
Description: Nothing is an offence which is done in the exercise of the right of private defence.

Title: Right of private defence of the body and of property
Description: Every person has the right, subject to the restrictions contained in section 99, to defend their own body and the body of any other person against certain offences.

Title: Right of private defence against the act of a person of unsound mind, etc.—
Description: When an act, which would otherwise be a certain offence, is not that offence, by reason of the youth, the want of maturity of understanding, the unsoundness of mind or the intoxication of the person doing that act, or by reason of any misconception on the part of that person, every person has the same right of private defence against that act which he would have if the act were that offence.

Title: Acts against which there is no right of private defence
Description: There is no right of private defence against an act which does not reasonably cause the apprehension of death or of grievous hurt, if done, or attempted to be done, by a public servant acting in good faith under colour of his office, though that act, may not be strictly justifiable by law.

Title: When the right of private defence of the body extends to causing death
Description: The right of private defence of the body extends, under the restrictions mentioned in the last preceding section, to the voluntary causing of death or of any other harm to the assailant, if the offence which occasions the exercise of the right be of any of the descriptions hereinafter enumerated, namely:

Title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
Description: If the offence be not of any of the descriptions enumerated in the last preceding section, the right of private defence of the body does not extend to the voluntary causing of death to the assailant, but does extend, under the restrictions mentioned in section 99, to the voluntary causing to the assailant of any harm other than death.

Title: Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of the body
Description: The right of private defence of the body commences as soon as a reasonable apprehension of danger to the body arises from an attempt or threat to commit the offence though the offence may not have been committed; and it continues as long as such apprehension of danger to the body continues.

Title: When the right of private defence of property extends to causing death
Description: The right of private defence of property extends, under the restrictions mentioned in section 99, to the voluntary causing of death or of any other harm to the wrong-doer, if the offence, the committing of which, or the attempting to commit which, occasions the exercise of the right, be an offence of any of the descriptions hereinafter enumerated, namely:

Title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
Description: If the offence, the committing of which, or the attempting to commit which occasions the exercise of the right of private defence, be theft, mischief, or criminal trespass, not of any of the descriptions enumerated in the last preceding section, that right does not extend to the voluntary causing of death, but does extend, subject to the restrictions mentioned in section 99, to the voluntary causing to the wrong-doer of any harm other than death.

Title: Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of property
Description: The right of private defence of property commences when a reasonable apprehension of danger to the property commences. The right of private defence of property against theft continues till the offender has effected his retreat with the property or either the assistance of the public authorities is obtained, or the property has been recovered.

Title: Right of private defence against deadly assault when there is risk of harm to innocent person
Description: If in the exercise of the right of private defence against an assault which reasonably causes the apprehension of death, the defender be so situated that he cannot effectually exercise that right without risk of harm to an innocent person, his right of private defence extends to the running of that risk.

Title: Abetment of a thing
Description: A person abets the doing of a thing, who: Instigates any person to do that thing; or Engages with one or more other person or persons in any conspiracy for the doing of that thing, if an act or illegal omission takes place in pursuance of that conspiracy, and in order to the doing of that thing; or Intentionally aids, by any act or illegal omission, the doing of that thing.

Title: Abettor
Description: A person abets an offence, who abets either the commission of an offence, or the commission of an act which would be an offence, if committed by a person capable by law of committing an offence with the same intention or knowledge as that of the abettor.

Title: Punishment of abetment if the act abetted is committed in consequence and where no express provision is made for its punishment
Description: Whoever abets any offence shall, if the act abetted is committed in consequence of the abetment, and no express provision is made by this Code for the punishment of such abetment, be punished with the punishment provided for the offence.

Title: Punishment of abetment if person abetted does act with different intention from that of abettor
Description: Whoever abets the commission of an offence shall, if the person abetted does the act with a different intention or knowledge from that of the abettor, be punished with the punishment provided for the offence which would have been committed if the act had been done with the intention or knowledge of the abettor and with no other.

Title: Liability of abettor when one act abetted and different act done
Description: When an Act is abetted and a different act is done, the abettor is liable for the act done, in the same manner and to the same extent as if he had directly abetted it:

Title: Abettor when liable to cumulative punishment for act abetted and for act done
Description: If the act for which the abettor is liable under the last preceding section is committed in addition to the act abetted, and constitute a distinct offence, the abettor is liable to punishment for each of the offences.

Title: Liability of abettor for an effect caused by the act abetted different from that intended by the abettor
Description: When an act is abetted with the intention on the part of the abettor of causing a particular effect, and an act for which the abettor is liable in consequence of the abetment, causes a different effect from that intended by the abettor, the abettor is liable for the effect caused, in the same manner and to the same extent as if he had abetted the act with the intention of causing that effect, provided he knew that the act abetted was likely to cause that effect.

Title: Abettor present when offence is committed
Description: Whenever any person, who is absent would be liable to be punished as an abettor, is present when the act or offence for which he would be punishable in consequence of the abetment is committed, he shall be deemed to have committed such act or offence.

Title: Abetment of offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life.—if offence not committed
Description: Whoever abets the commission of an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, shall, if that offence be not committed in consequence of the abetment, and no express provision is made by this Code for the punishment of such abetment, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine;

Title: Abetment of offence punishable with imprisonment—if offence be not committed
Description: Whoever abets an offence punishable with imprisonment shall, if that offence be not committed in consequence of the abetment, and no express provision is made by this Code for the punishment of such abetment, be punished with imprisonment of any description provided for that offence for a term which may extend to one-fourth part of the longest term provided for that offence; or with such fine as is provided for that offence, or with both;

Title: Abetting commission of offence by the public or by more than ten persons
Description: Whoever abets the commission of an offence by the public generally or by any number or class of persons exceeding ten, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

Title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life
Description: Whoever intending to facilitate or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby facilitate the commission of an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, voluntarily conceals, by any act or illegal omission, or by the use of encryption or any other information hiding tool, the existence of a design to commit such offence or makes any representation which he knows to be false respecting such design,shall, if that offence be committed, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or, if the offence be not committed, with imprisonment of either description, for a term which may extend to three years; and in either case shall also be liable to fine.

Title: Public servant concealing design to commit offence which it is his duty to prevent
Description: Whoever, being a public servant intending to facilitate or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby facilitate the commission of an offence which it is his duty as such public servant to prevent, voluntarily conceals, by any act or illegal omission or by the use of encryption or any other information hiding tool, the existence of a design to commit such offence, or makes any representation which he knows to be false respecting such design, shall, if that offence be committed, be punished with imprisonment of any description provided for the offence, for a term which may extend to one-half of the longest term of such imprisonment, or with such fine as is provided for that offence, or with both; or, if the offence be punishable with death or imprisonment for life, with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years; or, if the offence be not committed, shall be punished with imprisonment of any description provided for the offence for a term which may extend to one-fourth part of the longest term of such imprisonment or with such fine as is provided for the offence, or with both.

Title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
Description: Whoever, intending to facilitate or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby facilitate the commission of an offence punishable with imprisonment, voluntarily conceals, by any act or illegal omission, the existence of a design to commit such offence, or makes any representation which he knows to be false respecting such design, shall, if that offence be committed, be punished with imprisonment of the description provided for the offence, for a term which may extend to one-fourth, and, if the offence be not committed, to one-eighth, of the longest term of such imprisonment, or with such fine as is provided for the offence, or with both.

Title: Waging, or attempting to wage war, or abetting waging of war, against the Government of India
Description: Whoever wages war against the Government of India, or attempts to wage such war, or abets the waging of such war, shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life and shall also be liable to fine

Title: Collecting arms, etc., with intention of waging war against the Government of India
Description: Whoever collects men, arms or ammunition or otherwise prepares to wage war with the intention of either waging or being prepared to wage war against the Government of India, shall be punished with imprisonment for life or imprisonment of either description for a term not exceeding ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

Title: Concealing with intent to facilitate design to wage war
Description: Whoever by any act, or by any illegal omission, conceals the existence of a design to wage war against the Government of India, intending by such concealment to facilitate, or knowing it to be likely that such concealment will facilitate, the waging of such war, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

Title: Assaulting President, Governor, etc., with intent to compel or restrain the exercise of any lawful power
Description: Whoever, with the intention of inducing or compelling the President of India, or Governor of any State, to exercise or refrain from exercising in any manner any any of the lawful powers of such President or Governor, assaults or wrongfully restrains, or attempts wrongfully to restrain, or overawes, by means of criminal force or the show of criminal force, or attempts so to overawe, such President or Governor, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

Title: Waging war against any Asiatic Power in alliance with the Government of India
Description: Whoever wages war against the Government of any Asiatic Power in alliance or at peace with the Government of India or attempts to wage such war, or abets the waging of such war, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, to which fine may be added, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, to which fine may be added, or with fine.

Title: Committing depredation on territories of Power at peace with the Government of India
Description: Whoever commits depredation, or makes preparations to commit depredation, on the territories of any Power in alliance or at peace with the Government of India, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine and to forfeiture of any property used or intended to be used in committing such depredation, or acquired by such depredation.

Title: Receiving property taken by war or depredation mentioned in sections 125 and 126
Description: Whoever receives any property knowing the same to have been taken in the commission of any of the offences mentioned in sections 125 and 126, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine and to forfeiture of the property so received.

Title: Public servant voluntarily allowing prisoner of state or war to escape
Description: Whoever, being a public servant and having the custody of any State prisoner or prisoner of war, voluntarily allows such prisoner to escape from any place in which such prisoner is confined, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

Title: Public servant negligently suffering such prisoner to escape
Description: Whoever, being a public servant and having the custody of any State prisoner or prisoner of war, negligently suffers such prisoner to escape from any place of confinement in which such prisoner is confined, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

Title: Aiding escape of, rescuing or harbouring such prisoner
Description: Whoever knowingly aids or assists any State prisoner or prisoner of war in escaping from lawful custody, or rescues or attempts to rescue any such prisoner, or harbours or conceals any such prisoner who has escaped from lawful custody, or offers or attempts to offer any resistance to the recapture of such prisoner, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

Title: Abetting mutiny, or attempting to seduce a soldier, sailor or airman from his duty
Description: Whoever abets the committing of mutiny by an officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India or attempts to seduce any such officer, soldier, sailor or airman from his allegiance or his duty, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

Title: Abetment of mutiny, if mutiny is committed in consequence thereof
Description: Whoever abets the committing of mutiny by an officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India, shall, if mutiny be committed in consequence of that abetment, be punished with death or with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

Title: Abetment of assault by soldier, sailor or airman on his superior officer, when in execution of his office
Description: Whoever abets an assault by an officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India, on any superior officer being in the execution of his office, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

Title: Abetment of such assault, if the assault committed
Description: Whoever abets an assault by an officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India, on any superior officer being in the execution of his office, shall, if such assault be committed in consequence of that abetment be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

Title: Abetment of desertion of soldier, sailor or airman
Description: Whoever, abets the desertion of any officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

Title: Harbouring deserter
Description: Whoever, except as hereinafter excepted, knowing or having reason to believe that an officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India, has deserted, harbours such officer, soldier, sailor or airman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine or with both.

Title: Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel through negligence of master
Description: The master or person in charge of a merchant vessel, on board of which any deserter from the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India is concealed, shall, though ignorant of such concealment, be liable to a penalty not exceeding five hundred rupees, if he might have known of such concealment but for some neglect of his duty as such master or person in charge, or but for some want of discipline on board of the vessel.

Title: Abetment of act of insubordination by soldier, sailor or airman
Description: Whoever abets what he knows to be an act of insubordination by an officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or air Force, of the Government of India, shall, if such act of insubordination be committed in consequence of that abetment, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

Title: Persons subject to certain Acts
Description: No person subject to the Army Act, the Navy Act or the Air Force Act is subject to punishment under IPC for any of the offences in this Chapter.

Title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by soldier, sailor or airman
Description: Whoever, not being a soldier/sailor/airman, wears garb or carries a token resembling that used by them with intent to be believed to be one, shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 months, fine up to Rs. 500, or both.

Title: Unlawful assembly
Description: An assembly of 5 or more people to overawe the government/public servant, resist execution of law, commit mischief or criminal trespass, or take/obtain possession of property etc. by criminal force.

Title: Being member of unlawful assembly
Description: Whoever is aware of facts that make an assembly unlawful, and intentionally joins or continues in it.

Title: Punishment for unlawful assembly
Description: Imprisonment up to 6 months, fine, or both.

Title: Joining unlawful assembly armed with deadly weapon
Description: Whoever joins or continues in an armed unlawful assembly shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, fine, or both.

Title: Joining or continuing in unlawful assembly, knowing it has been commanded to disperse
Description: Whoever joins or continues in an unlawful assembly, knowing it has been ordered to disperse, shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, fine, or both.

Title: Rioting
Description: When force/violence is used by an unlawful assembly for its common object, every member is guilty of rioting.

Title: Punishment for rioting
Description: Imprisonment up to 2 years, fine, or both.

Title: Rioting armed with deadly weapon
Description: Whoever commits rioting armed with deadly weapon/offensive item likely to cause death, shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years, fine, or both.

Title: Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object
Description: If an offence is committed by any member of an unlawful assembly in prosecution of the common object of that assembly, every person who at the time of the committing of that offence is a member of the same assembly is guilty of that offence.

Title: Hiring or conniving at hiring of persons to join unlawful assembly
Description: Whoever hires or connives at the hiring, engagement, or employment of any person to join or become a member of any unlawful assembly shall be punishable as a member of such unlawful assembly.

Title: Knowingly joining or continuing in assembly of five or more persons after it has been commanded to disperse
Description: Whoever knowingly joins or continues in any assembly of five or more persons after such assembly has been lawfully commanded to disperse shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot, etc.
Description: Whoever assaults or obstructs any public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant in endeavoring to disperse an unlawful assembly or to suppress a riot or affray shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Wantonly giving provocation with intent to cause riot
Description: Whoever malignantly or wantonly by doing anything illegal gives provocation intending or knowing it to be likely to cause the offence of rioting shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Promoting enmity between different groups on ground of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, etc., and doing acts prejudicial to maintenance of harmony
Description: Whoever (a) by words, either spoken or written, or by signs or by visible representations or otherwise, promotes or attempts to promote, on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, caste or community or any other ground whatsoever, disharmony or feelings of enmity, hatred or ill will between different religious, racials, language or regional groups or castes or communities, or (b) commits any act which is prejudicial to the maintenance of harmony between different religious, racial, language or regional groups or castes or communities, and which disturbs or is likely  to disturb the public tranquillity. organizes any exercise, movement, drill or other similar activity intending that the  participants in such activity shall use or be trained to use criminal force or violence.Whoever commits an offence in any place of worship

Title: Owner or occupier of land on which an unlawful assembly is held
Description: The owner or occupier of the land upon which an unlawful assembly is held and any person having an interest in such land shall be punishable with fine if they do not give the earliest notice thereof to the nearest police station.

Title: Liability of person for whose benefit riot is committed
Description: Whenever a riot is committed for the benefit or on behalf of any person, such person shall be punishable with fine if he does not use all lawful means in his power to prevent such assembly or riot.

Title: Liability of agent of owner or occupier for whose benefit riot is committed
Description: The agent or manager of a person for whose benefit a riot is committed shall be punishable with fine if they do not use all lawful means to prevent such riot or assembly.

Title: Harbouring persons hired for an unlawful assembly
Description: Whoever harbors, receives, or assembles in any house or premises any persons knowing that such persons have been hired, engaged, or employed to join or become members of an unlawful assembly shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Being hired to take part in an unlawful assembly or riot
Description: Whoever is engaged or hired to do or assist in doing any of the acts specified in section 141 shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Affray
Description: When two or more persons by fighting in a public place disturb the public peace, they are said to “commit an affray”.

Title: Punishment for committing affray
Description: Whoever commits an affray shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Public servant taking gratification other than legal remuneration in respect of an official act
Description: A public servant who takes a gratuity for doing or forbearing to do any official act or for showing favor or disfavor in his official capacity shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Taking gratification, in order, by corrupt or illegal means, to influence public servant
Description: Anyone who takes a gratification to influence a public servant by corrupt or illegal means shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Taking gratification, for exercise of personal influence with public servant
Description: Whoever accepts gratification for exercising personal influence over a public servant shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Punishment for abetment by public servant of offences defined in sections 162 or 163
Description: A public servant who abets the offences defined in sections 162 or 163 shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Public servant obtaining valuable thing, without consideration, from person concerned in proceeding or business transacted by such public servant
Description: A public servant who obtains any valuable thing without consideration from a person concerned in any proceeding or business transacted by such public servant shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Punishment for abetment of offences defined in section 161 or section 165
Description: Whoever abets any offence punishable under section 161 or section 165 shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Public servant disobeying law, with intent to cause injury to any person
Description: A public servant who knowingly disobeys any direction of the law intended to cause injury to any person shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Punishment for non-treatment of victim
Description:
Whoever, being in charge of a hospital, public or 
private, whether run by the Central Government, the State Government, local bodies or any other person, 
contravenes the provisions of section 357C of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 (2 of 1974), shall be 
punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year or with fine or with both.

Title: Public servant framing an incorrect document with intent to cause injury
Description: A public servant who frames an incorrect document with intent to cause injury shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade
Description: A public servant who engages in trade or business in contravention of any law shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property
Description: A public servant who unlawfully buys or bids for property shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Personating a public servant
Description: Whoever personates a public servant shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant with fraudulent intent
Description: Whoever, not being a public servant, wears any garb or carries any token resembling any garb or token used by a public servant with fraudulent intent shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding
Description: Absconding to avoid being served with a summons, notice, or order from any public servant shall be punished with imprisonment or fine or both.

Title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant
Description: Whoever, not being a soldier, sailor or airman in the Military, Naval or Air service of the Government of India, wears any garb or carries any token resembling any garb or token used by such soldier, sailor or airman with the intention that it may be believed that he is such a soldier, sailor or airman, shall be punished with imprisonment

Title: Candidate and electoral right
Description: Definitions of "candidate" and "electoral right" for purposes of Chapter IXA

Title: Bribery
Description: Offence of bribery during elections

Title: Undue influence at elections
Description: Offence of undue influence during elections

Title: Personation at elections
Description: Offence of personation during elections

Title: Punishment for bribery
Description: Punishment for offence of bribery during elections

Title: Punishment for undue influence or personation at an election
Description: Punishment for offences of undue influence or personation during elections

Title: False statement in connection with an election
Description: Offence of making false statements relating to personal character or conduct of a candidate during elections

Title: Illegal payments in connection with an election
Description: Offence of making illegal payments for promoting or procuring the election of a candidate

Title: Failure to keep election accounts
Description: Offence of failure to keep accounts of election expenses

Title: Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding
Description: Offence of absconding to avoid service of summons, notice or order from a public servant

Title: Preventing service of summons or other proceedings, or preventing publication thereof
Description: Offence of intentionally preventing service of summons, notice or order issued by a public servant

Title: Non-attendance in obedience to an order from public servant
Description: Offence of non-attendance in obedience to an order from a public servant

Title: Non-appearance in response to a proclamation under section 82 of Act 2 of 1974
Description: Offence of non-appearance in response to a proclamation under section 82 of CrPC 1973

Title: Omission to produce document or electronic record to public servant by person legally bound to produce it
Description: Offence of omission to produce document or electronic record to public servant by person legally bound

Title: Omission to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound to give it
Description: Offence of omission to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound

Title: Furnishing false information
Description: Offence of furnishing false information to a public servant

Title: Refusing oath or affirmation when duly required by public servant to make it
Description: Offence of refusing to take oath or affirmation when required by a public servant

Title: Refusing to answer public servant authorized to question
Description: Offence of refusing to answer questions from a public servant authorized to question

Title: Refusing to sign statement
Description: Offence of refusing to sign statement made to a public servant when required

Title: False statement on oath or affirmation to public servant or person authorized to administer an oath or affirmation
Description: Offence of making false statement under oath or affirmation to a public servant or other authorized person

Title: False information, with intent to cause public servant to use his lawful power to the injury of another person
Description: Offence of providing false information to a public servant intending to cause injury to any person

Title: Resistance to the taking of property by the lawful authority of a public servant
Description: Offence of resisting or obstructing taking of property by lawful authority of public servant

Title: Obstructing sale of property offered for sale by authority of public servant
Description: Offence of obstructing sale of property offered for sale by lawful authority of public servant

Title: Illegal purchase or bid for property offered for sale by authority of public servant
Description: Offence related to illegal purchase or bid for property offered for sale by authority of public servant

Title: Obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions
Description: Offence of obstructing a public servant in discharge of his public functions

Title: Omission to assist public servant when bound by law to give assistance
Description: Offence of intentional omission to assist a public servant when legally bound to do so

Title: Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant
Description: Offence of disobeying an order promulgated by a public servant

Title: Threat of injury to public servant
Description: Offence of threatening injury to a public servant

Title: Threat of injury to induce person to refrain from applying for protection to public servant
Description: Offence of giving threat to prevent a person from seeking protection from a public servant

Title: Giving false evidence
Description: Offence of intentionally giving false evidence in a judicial proceeding

Title: Fabricating false evidence
Description: Offence of fabricating or making false evidence with intent to use it in a judicial proceeding

Title: Punishment for false evidence
Description: Punishment for offences under sections 191 and 192

Title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of capital offence
Description: Offence of giving or fabricating false evidence intending to procure conviction punishable with death

Title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of offence punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment
Description: Offence of giving or fabricating false evidence to procure conviction punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment

Title: Using evidence known to be false
Description: Offence of corruptly using as true evidence known to be false

Title: Issuing or signing false certificate
Description: Offence of issuing or signing false certificate required to be given by law

Title: Using as true a certificate known to be false
Description: Offence of corruptly using a false certificate as true knowing it to be false

Title: False statement made in declaration which is by law receivable as evidence
Description: Offence of making false statement in a declaration receivable as evidence by law

Title: Using as true such declaration knowing it to be false
Description: Offence of corruptly using as true a declaration known to be false

Title: Causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information to screen offender
Description: Offence of causing disappearance of evidence or giving false information to screen offender

Title: Intentional omission to give information of offence by person bound to inform
Description: Offence of intentional omission to give information of offence by person legally bound to inform

Title: Giving false information respecting an offence committed
Description: Offence of giving false information regarding an offence to screen offender

Title: Destruction of document or electronic record to prevent its production as evidence
Description: Offence of destroying document or electronic record to prevent its production as evidence

Title: False personation for purpose of act or proceeding in suit or prosecution
Description: Offence of false personation for the purpose of any act or proceeding in a suit or criminal prosecution

Title: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution
Description: Offence relating to fraudulent removal of property to prevent its seizure for forfeiture or execution of decree

Title: Fraudulent claim to property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution
Description: Offence relating to fraudulent claim made to prevent seizure of property for forfeiture or execution of decree

Title: Fraudulently suffering decree for sum not due
Description: Offence of fraudulently suffering decree for a sum not due

Title: Dishonestly making false claim in Court
Description: Offence of making false claim in court with intent to injure or annoy any person

Title: Fraudulently obtaining decree for sum not due
Description: Offence of fraudulently obtaining decree for sum not due

Title: False charge of offence made with intent to injure
Description: Offence of instituting criminal proceedings against a person with intent to cause injury

Title: Harbouring offender
Description: Offence of harbouring an offender who has committed an offence punishable with death or imprisonment

Title: Taking gift, etc., to screen an offender from punishment
Description: Offence of taking gratification to screen an offender from punishment

Title: Offering gift or restoration of property in consideration of screening offender
Description: Offence of offering gratification or restoration of property in consideration of screening offender

Title: Taking gift to help to recover stolen property, etc
Description: Offence of taking gratification to help recover stolen property without efforts to apprehend offender

Title: Harbouring offender who has escaped from custody or whose apprehension has been ordered
Description: Offence of harbouring offender who has escaped from custody or who has been ordered to be apprehended

Title: Penalty for harbouring robbers or dacoits
Description: Offence of harbouring robbers or dacoits

Title: Public servant disobeying direction of law with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture
Description: Offence of public servant disobeying law intending to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture

Title: Public servant framing incorrect record or writing with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture
Description: Offence of public servant framing incorrect record intending to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture

Title: Public servant in judicial proceeding corruptly making report, etc., contrary to law
Description: Offence of public servant corruptly making false report, order or decision during judicial proceeding

Title: Commitment for trial or confinement by person having authority who knows that he is acting contrary to law
Description: Offence by public servant vested with legal authority of committing persons for trial or confining, contrary to law

Title: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of public servant bound to apprehend
Description: Offence of intentional omission by public servant to apprehend person under legal obligation to do so

Title: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of public servant bound to apprehend person under sentence or lawfully committed
Description: Offence of intentional omission by public servant to apprehend sentenced person

Title: Escape from confinement or custody negligently suffered by public servant
Description: Offence of negligently suffering prisoner to escape by public servant responsible for keeping such person in confinement or custody

Title: Resistance or obstruction by a person to his lawful apprehension
Description: Offence of resisting or obstructing lawful apprehension of self

Title: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension of another person
Description: Offence of resisting or obstructing lawful apprehension of another person

Title: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension, or escape or rescue
Description: This legal provision, Section 225B, addresses resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension, escape, or rescue in cases not covered by Section 224 or Section 225, or any other existing law. It stipulates that anyone intentionally impeding their own or another person's lawful apprehension, attempting to escape lawful custody, or trying to rescue someone from legal detention can be punished.

Title: Violation of condition of remission of punishment
Description: Punishes whoever violates any condition on which remission of punishment was granted

Title: Intentional insult or interruption to public servant sitting in judicial proceeding
Description: Punishes whoever intentionally offers insult or causes interruption to a public servant in a judicial proceeding with simple imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Disclosure of identity of the victim of certain offences
Description: Punishes disclosure of identity of victim of certain sexual offences without prior permission

Title: Personation of a juror or assessor
Description: Punishes whoever intentionally personates a juror or assessor with imprisonment up to 2 years, fine, or both

Title: Failure by person released on bail or bond to appear in Court
Description: Punishes whoever fails to appear before court after release on bail or bond without sufficient cause

Title: Coin defined
Description: Defines coin as metal used as money, stamped and issued by authority to be used as money

Title: Counterfeiting coin
Description: Punishes counterfeiting or performing any part of process of counterfeiting coin with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Counterfeiting Indian coin
Description: Punishes counterfeiting or any part of process of counterfeiting Indian coin with imprisonment for life or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

Title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting coin
Description: Punishes making, mending or buying, selling, disposing instrument for counterfeiting coin with imprisonment up to 3 years and fine

Title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Indian coin
Description: Punishes making, mending or buying, selling, disposing instrument for counterfeiting Indian coin with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting coin
Description: Punishes possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting coin with imprisonment up to 3 years and fine, for Indian coin imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

Title: Abetting counterfeiting coin out of India
Description: Punishes abetment out of India of counterfeiting coin in India with same punishment as counterfeiting Indian coin

Title: Import or export of counterfeit coin
Description: Punishes import or export of counterfeit coin knowing it to be counterfeit with imprisonment up to 3 years and fine

Title: Import or export of counterfeits of Indian coin
Description: Punishes import or export of counterfeits of Indian coin knowing it to be counterfeit with imprisonment for life or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

Title: Delivery of coin possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
Description: Punishes delivery to any person or attempt to induce any person to receive counterfeit coin knowing it to be counterfeit, with imprisonment up to 5 years and fine

Title: Delivery of Indian coin possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
Description: Punishes delivery to any person or attempt to induce any person to receive counterfeit Indian coin knowing it to be counterfeit, with imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

Title: Delivery of coin as genuine which is counterfeit when first possessed
Description: Punishes delivery of coin, counterfeit when received by deliverer but not known by him to be counterfeit then, as genuine or different coin with imprisonment up to 2 years or fine up to 10 times the value of the coin

Title: Possession of counterfeit coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed
Description: Punishes possession of counterfeit coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he took possession with imprisonment up to 3 years and fine

Title: Possession of Indian coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed
Description: Punishes possession of counterfeit Indian coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he took possession with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Person employed in mint causing coin to be different from that fixed by law
Description: Punishes person employed in mint who causes coin issued from that mint to differ from prescribed weight or composition, with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Unlawfully taking coining instrument from mint
Description: Punishes unauthorized taking out of mint any coining tool or instrument with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Fraudulently diminishing weight or altering composition of coin
Description: Punishes fraudulently diminishing weight or altering composition of coin with imprisonment up to 3 years and fine

Title: Fraudulently diminishing weight or altering composition of Indian coin
Description: Punishes fraudulently diminishing weight or altering composition of Indian coin with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Altering appearance of coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description
Description: Punishes altering appearance of coin intending it to pass as coin of different description with imprisonment up to 3 years and fine

Title: Altering appearance of Indian coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description
Description: Punishes altering appearance of Indian coin intending it to pass as different coin, with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Delivery of coin possessed with knowledge that it is altered
Description: Punishes delivery of coin with altered appearance and knowledge of alteration, as genuine or different coin, with imprisonment up to 5 years and fine

Title: Delivery of Indian coin possessed with knowledge that it is altered
Description: Punishes delivery of Indian coin with altered appearance and knowledge of alteration, as genuine or different coin, with imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

Title: Possession of coin by person who knew it to be altered when he became possessed
Description: Punishes possession of altered coin by person who knew it be altered when he took possession, with imprisonment up to 3 years and fine

Title: Possession of Indian coin by person who knew it to be altered when he became possessed
Description: Punishes possession of altered Indian coin by person who knew it be altered when he took possession, with imprisonment up to 5 years and fine

Title: Delivery of coin as genuine which is altered and not known to be so when possesssed
Description: Punishes delivery of altered coin, not known to be altered when deliverer took possession, as genuine or different coin, with imprisonment up to 2 years or fine up to 10 times the value of coin

Title: Counterfeiting Government stamp
Description: Punishes counterfeiting or any part of process of counterfeiting Government revenue stamp with imprisonment for life or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

Title: Having possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting Government stamp
Description: Punishes possession of instrument or material for purpose of counterfeiting Government revenue stamp with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Government stamp
Description: Punishes making, selling, disposing any instrument for purpose of counterfeiting Government revenue stamp with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Sale of counterfeit Government stamp
Description: Punishes sale or offer for sale of any counterfeit Government revenue stamp with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Having possession of counterfeit Government stamp
Description: Punishes possession of counterfeit Government revenue stamp to use or dispose as genuine, with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Using as genuine a Government stamp known to be counterfeit
Description: Punishes use as genuine of Government revenue stamp known to be counterfeit with imprisonment up to 7 years or fine or both

Title: Effacing writing from substance bearing Government stamp, or removing from document a stamp used for it
Description: Punishes fraudulently removing writing or stamp from document bearing Government revenue stamp, with imprisonment up to 3 years, fine, or both

Title: Using Government stamp known to have been before used
Description: Punishes fraudulently reusing Government revenue stamp known to have been already used, with imprisonment up to 2 years, fine, or both

Title: Erasure of mark denoting stamp has been used
Description: Punishes fraudulently erasing mark showing Government revenue stamp to have been used, or possessing such stamp, with imprisonment up to 3 years, fine, or both

Title: Prohibition of fictitious stamps
Description: Punishes making, selling, using, possessing fictitious stamps or instruments for making them, seizure and forfeiture of such stamps and instruments

Title: Fraudulent use of false instrument for weighing
Description: Punishes fraudulent use of false instrument for weighing with imprisonment up to 1 year, fine, or both

Title: Fraudulent use of false weight or measure
Description: Punishes fraudulent use of false weight or measure with imprisonment up to 1 year, fine, or both

Title: Being in possession of false weight or measure
Description: Punishes possession of false weight or measure intending it to be fraudulently used, with imprisonment up to 1 year, fine, or both

Title: Making or selling false weight or measure
Description: Punishes making, selling or disposing false weight or measure to be used as true with imprisonment up to 1 year, fine, or both

Title: Public nuisance
Description: Offence of public nuisance by doing any act or illegal omission causing common injury, danger or annoyance to public

Title: Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
Description: Punishes negligent act likely to spread infection of life-threatening disease with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine, or both

Title: Malignant act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
Description: Punishes malignant act likely to spread infection of life-threatening disease with imprisonment up to 2 years, fine, or both

Title: Disobedience to quarantine rule
Description: Punishes disobedience to quarantine rules with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine, or both

Title: Adulteration of food or drink intended for sale
Description: Punishes adulteration of food or drink to make it noxious, intending to sell it or knowing it is likely to be sold, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Sale of noxious food or drink
Description: Punishes sale, offer or exposure for sale of noxious food or drink knowing it to be noxious, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Adulteration of drugs
Description: Punishes adulteration of any drug or medical preparation to lessen efficacy or change operation, intending it to be sold or used as unadulterated, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Sale of adulterated drugs
Description: Punishes sale, issuance from dispensary, use by any person, of drug or medical preparation known to be adulterated, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Sale of drug as a different drug or preparation
Description: Punishes knowingly selling, issuing from dispensary, any drug or medical preparation as a different drug or preparation, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Fouling water of public spring or reservoir
Description: Punishes voluntarily corrupting or fouling water of public spring or reservoir to make it less fit for ordinary use, with imprisonment up to 3 months, fine up to Rs. 500, or both

Title: Making atmosphere noxious to health
Description: Punishes voluntarily vitiating atmosphere to make it noxious to public health, with fine up to Rs. 500

Title: Rash driving or riding on a public way
Description: Punishes rash or negligent driving or riding on a public road endangering human life or likely to cause hurt or injury, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Rash navigation of vessel
Description: Punishes rash or negligent navigation of vessel endangering human life or likely to cause hurt or injury, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Exhibition of false light, mark or buoy
Description: Punishes exhibition of false light, mark or buoy to mislead navigators, with imprisonment up to 7 years, fine, or both

Title: Conveying person by water for hire in unsafe or overloaded vessel
Description: Punishes knowingly or negligently conveying person for hire in unsafe or overloaded vessel, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Danger or obstruction in public way or navigation line
Description: Punishes causing danger, obstruction or injury in any public way or navigation line, with fine up to Rs. 200

Title: Negligent conduct with respect to poisonous substance
Description: Punishes negligent conduct with poison likely to endanger human life or cause hurt, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter
Description: Punishes negligent conduct with fire or combustible substance likely to endanger human life or cause hurt, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Negligent conduct with respect to explosive substance
Description: Punishes negligent conduct with explosive substance likely to endanger human life or cause hurt, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Negligent conduct with respect to machinery
Description: Punishes negligent conduct with machinery likely to endanger human life or cause hurt, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Negligent conduct with respect to pulling down or repairing buildings
Description: Punishes negligent omission to take precautions against danger to human life from repair or demolition of buildings, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Negligent conduct with respect to animal
Description: Punishes negligent omission to take precautions against danger to human life or grievous hurt from any animal, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Punishment for public nuisance in cases not otherwise provided
Description: Punishes public nuisance in cases not specially provided with fine up to Rs. 200

Title: Continuance of nuisance after injunction to discontinue
Description: Punishes continuance of public nuisance after injunction to discontinue, with simple imprisonment up to 6 months, fine, or both

Title: Sale, etc., of obscene books, etc.
Description: Punishes sale, distribution, possession, publication, import, export of obscene objects

Title: Sale, etc., of obscene objects to young person
Description: Punishes sale, distribution, exhibition or circulation to persons under 20 years of obscene objects described u/s 292

Title: Obscene acts and songs
Description: Punishes obscene acts or songs in public places to annoyance of others, with imprisonment up to 3 months, fine, or both

Title: Injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult religion
Description: Punishes destroying, damaging or defiling any place of worship or sacred object to insult religion of any class of persons, with imprisonment up to 2 years, fine, or both

Title: Deliberate and malicious acts intended to outrage religious feelings
Description: Punishes acts intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or beliefs with imprisonment up to 3 years, fine, or both

Title: Disturbing religious assembly
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing disturbance to any assembly engaged in religious worship or ceremonies, with imprisonment up to 1 year, fine, or both

Title: Trespassing on burial places, etc.
Description: Punishes trespass on burial places, etc. with intention to wound feelings or insult religion of any person, with imprisonment up to 1 year, fine, or both

Title: Uttering words, etc., with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings
Description: Punishes uttering any word or making any sound, gesture or exhibit object intending to wound religious feelings of any person, with imprisonment up to 1 year, fine, or both

Title: Culpable homicide
Description: Defines culpable homicide as causing death with intention, knowledge or reason to believe that act is likely to cause death

Title: Murder
Description: Defines murder and provides punishment of death or life imprisonment along with liability to fine

Title: Causing death by act with intention or knowledge that it will likely cause death
Description: Provides punishment for causing death by act done with intention or knowledge that it is likely to cause death

Title: Punishment for murder
Description: Prescribes punishment of death or imprisonment for life and liability to fine for murder

Title: Punishment for murder by life-convict
Description: Prescribes punishment of death for murder committed by a person under sentence of imprisonment for life

Title: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder
Description: Prescribes punishment of life imprisonment or imprisonment up to 10 years with or without fine for culpable homicide not amounting to murder

Title: Causing death by negligence
Description: Punishes causing death by rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide, with imprisonment up to 2 years, fine, or both

Title: Dowry death
Description: Defines and prescribes punishment for dowry death

Title: Abetment of suicide of child or insane person
Description: Punishes abetment of suicide by child or insane or delirious person or idiot, if suicide is committed, with death, imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years with or without fine

Title: Abetment of suicide
Description: Punishes abetment of suicide if suicide is committed, with imprisonment up to 10 years and liability to fine

Title: Attempt to murder
Description: Punishes attempt to commit murder with imprisonment up to 10 years and liability to fine, imprisonment for life if hurt caused

Title: Attempt to commit culpable homicide
Description: Punishes attempt to commit culpable homicide not amounting to murder, if hurt is caused with imprisonment up to 7 years with liability to fine

Title: Attempt to commit suicide
Description: Punishes attempt to commit suicide with simple imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

Title: Thug
Description: Defines thug when any person habitually commits robbery or child-stealing by means of murder

Title: Punishment for being a thug
Description: Prescribes punishment of imprisonment for life and liability to fine for being a thug

Title: Causing miscarriage
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing miscarriage of woman with child, if done to save life then in good faith, with imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

Title: Causing miscarriage without woman's consent
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing miscarriage of woman with or without her consent, with imprisonment for life or imprisonment up to 10 years and liability to fine

Title: Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage
Description: Punishes act done with intent to cause miscarriage, if causing death of woman, with imprisonment up to 10 years and liability to fine, imprisonment for life if done without woman's consent

Title: Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive or to cause it to die after birth
Description: Punishes act done before birth of child with intent to prevent it from being born alive, or to cause its death after birth, if act prevents child being born alive or causes its death after birth

Title: Causing death of quick unborn child by act amounting to culpable homicide
Description: Punishes doing an act under such circumstances that if it caused death it would be culpable homicide, and act causes death of a quick unborn child, with imprisonment up to 10 years and liability to fine

Title: Exposure and abandonment of child under twelve years by parent or person having care of it
Description: Punishes exposure or abandonment of child under 12 years with intent to wholly abandon it, by the parent or person having its care, with imprisonment up to 7 years, fine, or both

Title: Concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body
Description: Punishes secretly burying or disposing dead body of child to conceal its birth, with imprisonment up to 2 years, fine, or both

Title: Hurt
Description: Defines hurt as bodily pain, disease or infirmity caused to any person

Title: Grievous hurt
Description: Defines grievous hurt and lists the kinds of hurt considered as grievous. Such as Emasculation, Permanent privation of the sight of either eye or hearing of either ear, Privation of any member or joint , Fracture or dislocation of a bone or tooth and Any hurt which endangers life or which causes the sufferer to be during the space of  twenty days

Title: Voluntarily causing hurt
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing hurt, except in cases under section 334, with imprisonment up to 1 year, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing grievous hurt, except in cases under section 335, with imprisonment up to 7 years and liability to fine

Title: Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt
Description: Prescribes punishment for voluntarily causing hurt

Title: Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means, except in cases under section 334, with imprisonment up to 3 years, fine, or both

Title: Punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt
Description: Prescribes punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt

Title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means, except in cases under section 335, with imprisonment up to 10 years and liability to fine

Title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by use of acid, etc.
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing grievous hurt by use of acid with imprisonment not less than 10 years up to life, with fine

Title: Voluntarily throwing or attempting to throw acid
Description: Punishes voluntarily throwing or attempting to throw acid on any person with imprisonment not less than 5 years up to 7 years, and liability to fine

Title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing hurt to extort property or constrain to an illegal act, with imprisonment up to 10 years and liability to fine

Title: Causing hurt by means of poison, etc., with intent to commit an offence
Description: Punishes administering poison etc. with intent to cause hurt to commit an offence, with imprisonment up to 10 years and liability to fine

Title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort property or constrain to an illegal act, with imprisonment up to 10 years and liability to fine

Title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing hurt to extort confession or information or to compel restoration of property or payment, etc. with imprisonment up to 7 years and liability to fine

Title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort confession or information or to compel restoration of property or payment, etc. with imprisonment up to 10 years and liability to fine

Title: Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from duty, with imprisonment up to 3 years, fine, or both

Title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from his duty
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from duty, with imprisonment up to 10 years and liability to fine

Title: Voluntarily causing hurt on provocation
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing simple hurt on grave and sudden provocation, with imprisonment up to 1 month, fine up to Rs. 500, or both

Title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt on provocation
Description: Punishes voluntarily causing grievous hurt on grave and sudden provocation, with imprisonment up to 4 years, fine up to Rs. 2000, or both

Title: Act endangering life or personal safety of others
Description: Punishes doing any rash or negligent act endangering human life or personal safety of others, with imprisonment up to 3 months, fine up to Rs. 250, or both

Title: Causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
Description: Punishes causing hurt by rash or negligent act endangering human life or personal safety of others, with imprisonment up to 6 months, fine up to Rs. 500, or both

Title: Causing grievous hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
Description: Punishes causing grievous hurt by rash or negligent act endangering human life or personal safety of others, with imprisonment up to 2 years, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Wrongful restraint
Description: Defines wrongful restraint as obstructing any person from proceeding in any direction where he/she has right to proceed

Title: Wrongful confinement
Description: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person in such a manner as to  prevent that person from proceedings beyond certain circumscribing limits, is said “wrongfully to  confine” that person

Title: Punishment for wrongful restraint
Description: Punishes wrongful restraint with simple imprisonment up to 1 month, fine up to Rs. 500, or both

Title: Punishment for wrongful confinement
Description: Punishes wrongful confinement with imprisonment up to 1 year, fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Wrongful confinement for three or more days
Description: Punishes wrongful confinement for 3 or more days with imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

Title: Wrongful confinement for ten or more days
Description: Punishes wrongful confinement for 10 or more days with imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

Title: Wrongful confinement of person for whose liberation writ has been issued
Description: Punishes continuing wrongful confinement of person after writ for liberation has been issued, with imprisonment up to 2 years in addition to any other punishment

Title: Wrongful confinement in secret
Description: Punishes wrongful confinement in secret with intent to conceal place of confinement, with imprisonment up to 2 years in addition to any other punishment

Title: Wrongful confinement to extort property, or constrain to illegal act
Description: Punishes wrongful confinement to extort property or constrain to do anything illegal, with imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

Title: Wrongful confinement to extort confession, or compel restoration of property
Description: Punishes wrongful confinement to extort confession, information or restoration of property, with imprisonment up to 3 years and fine

Title: Force
Description: Defines force and its three kinds as bodily force, disposed substances and induced animal motion

Title: Criminal force
Description: Defines criminal force as intentionally using force without consent to commit an offence, or intending or knowing it likely to cause injury, fear or annoyance

Title: Assault
Description: Defines assault as making gesture or preparation intending or knowing it likely to cause apprehension of criminal force

Title: Punishment for assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation
Description: Punishes assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation with imprisonment up to 3 months, fine up to Rs. 500, or both

Title: Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty
Description: Punishes assault or criminal force to deter public servant from duty with imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

Title: Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty
Description: Punishes assault or criminal force to woman intending to outrage her modesty with imprisonment between 1 to 5 years and fine

Title: Sexual harassment
Description: Defines and punishes sexual harassment

Title: Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe
Description: Punishes assault or criminal force to any woman intending to disrobe her, with imprisonment between 3 to 7 years and fine

Title: Voyeurism
Description: Punishes voyeurism with imprisonment between 1 to 3 years on first conviction, and between 3 to 7 years on subsequent conviction, and fine

Title: Stalking
Description: Defines and punishes stalking of a woman

Title: Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonour person
Description: Punishes assault or criminal force with intent to dishonour a person, with imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

Title: Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of property
Description: Punishes assault or criminal force in attempting to commit theft on any person's property, with imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

Title: Assault or criminal force in attempt wrongfully to confine a person
Description: Punishes assault or criminal force to wrongfully confine any person, with imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

Title: Assault or criminal force on grave provocation
Description: Punishes assault or criminal force on grave and sudden provocation, with simple imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 200, or both

Title: Kidnapping
Description: Defines kidnapping and its two kinds - kidnapping from India and kidnapping from lawful guardianship

Title: Kidnapping from India
Description: Defines and punishes kidnapping of any person from India without consent or legal authority

Title: Kidnapping from lawful guardianship
Description: Defines and punishes kidnapping of a minor or person of unsound mind from lawful guardianship without consent

Title: Abduction
Description: Defines abduction as compelling, deceiving or inducing any person to go from any place

Title: Punishment for kidnapping
Description: Punishes kidnapping from India or lawful guardianship with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Kidnapping or maiming a minor for purposes of begging
Description: Punishes kidnapping or maiming of minor for purposes of begging, employing or using minor for begging, with imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

Title: Kidnapping or abducting in order to murder
Description: Punishes kidnapping or abducting any person in order to murder, with imprisonment for life or up to 10 years and fine

Title: Kidnapping for ransom, etc.
Description: Punishes kidnapping for ransom, threatening to cause death or hurt, with death, imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

Title: Kidnapping or abducting with intent secretly and wrongfully to confine person
Description: Punishes kidnapping or abducting intending to secretly and wrongfully confine the person, with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

Title: Kidnapping, abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage
Description: Punishes kidnapping or abducting any woman to compel her marriage or to force or seduce her to illicit intercourse, with imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

Title: Procuration of minor girl
Description: Punishes procuring minor girl for purposes of sexual intercourse, with imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

Title: Importation of girl from foreign country
